messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] New-to everything!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Joanne, Congratulations on your family.Bonding with you family is sooo important.I hope everything goes well for you. Alex Good evening... I joined recently
messages.messageBody:
Hi Joanne,
Congratulations on your family.Bonding with you family is sooo important.I hope everything goes well for you.
Alex



Good evening...

I joined recently and wanted to quickly introduce myself before I
continue reading.
I just removed two of my three children from public school (my 9 yr.
old daughter in December & my 12 year old son last month) and have
another still in public school, my 6 yr. old daughter in the 1st
grade. We'll be removing her when this school year is finished.
We're (my husband & I) new parents to our children...we adopted them
(all three at once, they're biological siblings) 15 months ago.
Our main reason for removing them (and soon our younger one) is for
bonding reasons. Having them in school 30-35 hours a week was leaving
little time to bond as a family and to work through important issues.

That's us in a nutshell. LOL I'm Joanne, a New Yorker, recently moved
to Central Florida and not missing the snow. LOL

messages.subject: New-to everything!
messages.msgSnippet: Good evening... I joined recently and wanted to quickly introduce myself before I continue reading. I just removed two of my three children from public school
messages.messageBody:
Good evening...

I joined recently and wanted to quickly introduce myself before I
continue reading.
I just removed two of my three children from public school (my 9 yr.
old daughter in December & my 12 year old son last month) and have
another still in public school, my 6 yr. old daughter in the 1st
grade. We'll be removing her when this school year is finished.
We're (my husband & I) new parents to our children...we adopted them
(all three at once, they're biological siblings) 15 months ago.
Our main reason for removing them (and soon our younger one) is for
bonding reasons. Having them in school 30-35 hours a week was leaving
little time to bond as a family and to work through important issues.

That's us in a nutshell. LOL I'm Joanne, a New Yorker, recently moved
to Central Florida and not missing the snow. LOL
